name: multitude
content:
a multitude of
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large number of people or things: The city has a multitude of problems, from homelessness to drugs and murder.
See more the multitude
a large crowd of people: He stepped out onto the balcony to address the multitude below. She couldn't get through the multitude surrounding the stage. The multitude called for his execution. the multitudes
[ plural ] large numbers of people: the multitudes using the internet
See more the multitude
the ordinary people who form the largest group in a society

a large number of things: [ U ] Two large circles are surrounded by a multitude of small, colorful squares. [ pl ] As manager of the restaurant, his job is to feed the multitudes (= large numbers of people).
